qas.question: What type of treatise is the Book on Numbers and Computation considered to be?
How many mathematical treatises have still managed to survive to this day?
What achievement of the Han era can be used to help solve linear equations?
During what era was the Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art from?
What can be used to help find the roots of equations?

context: <a1_0>Three<a1_0/> <a3_0>Han<a3_0/> <a0_0>mathematical<a0_0/> treatises still exist. These are the Book on Numbers and Computation, the Arithmetical Classic of the Gnomon and the Circular Paths of Heaven and the Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art. Han-era mathematical achievements include solving problems with right-angle triangles, square roots, cube roots, and matrix methods, finding more accurate approximations for pi, providing mathematical proof of the Pythagorean theorem, use of the decimal fraction, <a2_0>Gaussian elimination<a2_0/> to solve linear equations, and <a4_0>continued fractions<a4_0/> to find the roots of equations.
